questionsData.title: Vinegar is a sweet liquid.
Evaporates and melts are synonyms.
The glass of mirror refracts light.
Sound is created by something that is silent.
Vaccines are very weak forms of disease.
The sun eclipse is when the sun disappears during the daylight.
Cloth and rubber are kinds of materials.
questionsData.explain_answer: Yes, the sentence "Cloth and rubber are kinds of materials" is grammatically correct. It states that cloth and rubber are both types or categories of materials.

questionsData.title: Unusual animal is a common animal.
People like to drive in misty weather.
Telescopes are used to study germs.
Flood is a deep water over normally dry land.
"Helpless " means " in a bad condition".
The president is the person who takes charge of schools.
questionsData.explain_answer: The president is the person who takes charge of country.

questionsData.title: Weekend is the last day of the week.
Tourist guide is the one who guides soldiers.
questionsData.explain_answer: Tourist guide is the one who guides tourists.

questionsData.title: Applicants are people who apply for the jobs.
Igloo is a kind of sandy house.
Re- pack is to pack again.
To pace is to walk with slow, regular steps.
"Mutiny" means "to disobey the rules".
The text is mainly talking about ……….
questionsData.article:
Diamond is a form of pure carbon, transparent, colorless crystals. It may (occur 1) in different coloured forms
owing to presence of some melted oxide, which gives the colouration of several colors red, yellow, green, blue, or
black to the diamond. It could be found in the nature as (irregular 2) pieces. Diamond is brilliant when it’s
polished and smoothed for jewels manufacturing purposes. It is formed in the nature through crystallization of the
carbon underground by the influence of extreme heat and pressure. Diamond is the hardest substance known in the
nature. It is used to scratching and cutting other jewels and to polish (them 3). Diamond shows very high melting
point (about 3500 C). It is a bad conductor of electricity. It is a good conductor of heat because the electrons in the
bonds are shared and hence the heat can be dissipated easily. When a beam of light is directed to its faces, it
scattered and emitted as flashes in different direction, giving the diamond it’s brilliance and shining.

questionsData.title: There isn't …….. milk in the fridge.
The compound word is …......
We like apples. The word "like" is a/an……….
questionsData.explain_answer:
In the sentence "We like apples," the word "like" is a verb.

Here's why:

  • Verb: A verb describes an action, state of being, or occurrence. In this sentence, "like" describes your feelings of enjoyment towards apples.
  • Noun: A noun names a person, place, thing, or idea. "Like" doesn't fit into any of these categories.
  • Adverb: An adverb modifies a verb, adjective, or another adverb. "Like" doesn't modify anything in this sentence.
  • Adjective: An adjective describes a noun or pronoun. "Like" doesn't describe anything in this sentence.

questionsData.title: ………is a prefix.
Salem is the ….. student in the class.
Samsung mobile is ….. expensive than iPhone.
Nada is excellent …….Chemistry and English.
That is the park ……..we go every Friday.
questionsData.explain_answer:
The answer is where.

Which is used for asking about a specific item from a group of choices. (e.g. Which park do you like the most?)
Who is used for asking about people. (e.g. Who goes to the park with you?)
When is used for asking about time. (e.g. When do you go to the park?)
Where is used for asking about location. (e.g. That is the park where we go every Friday.)

questionsData.title: He failed the exams ………..they were difficult.
In Islam, parents must be treated…….. by sons and daughters.
questionsData.explain_answer:
In Islam, parents must be treated politely by sons and daughters.

The word "politely" is the correct choice in this context. It is an adverb that describes the manner in which parents should be treated. Treating parents politely means showing respect, kindness, and good manners towards them.

questionsData.title: She always ……. breakfast at 7:30 every day.
The minister of education …. visit our school tomorrow.
questionsData.explain_answer:
The minister of education is to visit our school tomorrow.

The verb to be + to + infinitive

Examples: The President is to meet the ambassador tomorrow.
The thick fog is to clear this afternoon.
You can use these structure to talk about future plans or forecasts. You often see it in newspaper.
